dataModel.title: Prototype Veg Plots Database Component Description: treeStem
dataModel.author: J. Harris
dataModel.description: This table stores stem data collected from a plot.

entity.entitySummary: This table is intended to store information about the tree stem data collected while sampling a plot.
entity.entityDescription: This table was added after the September meeting at NCEAS because of the recognization that there were often attributes related to plant stems that are commonly measured while sampling a plot. There was broad interest in being able to include some of these measurements in the plots database.

attribute.attDefinition: Primary Key for the stemData table.

attribute.attNotes: Through this foreign key the stem data are linked to a specific taxon observation.
attribute.attDefinition: Foreign key into the taxonObservation table.

attribute.attNotes: Name applied to a specific stem by the plot author.
attribute.attDefinition: This column stores the name or code applied to a specific stem in the plot.

attribute.attNotes: Business rules will dictate that if a worker collects diameter by class, the value of the mid-point between the low end and high end for the class will be positioned here and the offset between this and the endpoints will be stored in the stemDiameterAccuracy attribute.
attribute.attDefinition: This column stores the diameter of the stem in meters.

attribute.attNotes: Business rules maintain that the if the plot collector uses classes for collecting stem diameter data then the class midpoint is stored in the stemDiameter attribute and the difference between this midpoint and an endpoint is stored in this field.
attribute.attDefinition: This column stores the accuracy of the stem diameter measurements.

attribute.attNotes: See the dsgpoly attribute in the plot table - the format is the same. The user interface to the prototype system will allow the user to enter relative the relative position of stems (wrt the plot origin) but will convert the data to latitude and longitude.
attribute.attDefinition: This column stores the position (lat., long.) of the stem.

attribute.attNotes: Business rules maintain that the if the plot collector uses classes for collecting stem heights then the class midpoint is stored in the stemHeight attribute and the difference between this midpoint and an endpoint is stored in the stemHeightAccuracy field.
attribute.attDefinition: This column stores the measured height of the stem in meters.
This column stores the measured height of a stem.

attribute.attNotes: The number of stems of a single species of plant that have common stem height, stem diameter, and no position or code data.
attribute.attDefinition: This column stores the measured height of a stem.
